author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for automatic merging.

I will automatically merge this pull request after the mandatory waiting period has elapsed.

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment.

(If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.)

---
On a separate note, I see that you are registering a release with a version number of the form `v0.X.Y`.

Does your package have a stable public API? If so, then it's time for you to register version `v1.0.0` of your package. (This is not a requirement. It's just a recommendation.)

If your package does not yet have a stable public API, then of course you are not yet ready to release version `v1.0.0`.

---
[noblock]
Why do you want to register an example package?

> Why do you want to register an example package? I don't. I was following an online example. However, I could not find the "close pull request" button to cancel before it got this far. I don't know why I don't see it. Thanks for any assistance !! This is what the example screen looks like: This is what my screen looks like: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7108393/66974856-63ddac80-f051-11e9-943e-e1508692fb8f.png)

Now that we have commented on this pull request, we have disabled automerging.

Only a registry maintainer can close this PR. But since you've commented that you don't want it, a maintainer will close this PR within the next few days.

> Now that we have commented on this pull request, we have disabled automerging.
> 
> Only a registry maintainer can close this PR. But since you've commented that you don't want it, a maintainer will close this PR within the next few days.

Should I be able to "close pull request" ?
(I am making an effort to learn as quickly as possible. And will avoid repeating mistakes.)

Cheers !
Nope, since the PR is made by a bot (`JuliaRegistrator`), the only people that can see the "Close Pull Request" button are the registry maintainers.

> Nope, since the PR is made by a bot (`JuliaRegistrator`), the only people that can see the "Close Pull Request" button are the registry maintainers.

Thank you, sir !
(Live and learn : )

Given https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/4016 I am guessing this is from @ChrisRackauckas tutorial or something? Would it be possible to add a note about not actually performing that step? :)
I caused chaos ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇ . Yeah, I should put an annotation onto the video that says you shouldn't try to register an example package: just do this with real packages. Or something of that nature.
